alert.note: Alert for Blackfoot Mountains; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 7:40PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Caribou, Oneida, southeastern Bannock, southeastern Power, northwestern Franklin and southeastern Cassia Counties through 815 PM MDT... At 740 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Swanlake to 10 miles south of Juniper. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Malad, Swanlake, Downey, Pleasantview, Holbrook Summit, Clifton, Oxford, Samaria, Daniels Reservoir, Holbrook, Malad Pass, and Stone. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Blackfoot Mountains; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region
